itemDescription: Signatory of the US Declaration of Independence, from Wales

wikipedia_page.main: Francis Lewis (March 21, 1713 – December 31, 1802) was a Welsh merchant and signer of the United States Declaration of Independence as a representative of New York.

response: *1803 – Francis Lewis, Welsh-American merchant and politician (b. 1713)
*1713 – Francis Lewis, Welsh-American merchant and politician (d. 1803)
* December 31 – Francis Lewis, signer of the United States Declaration of Independence (b. 1713)
* December 30 – Francis Lewis, American signer of the Declaration of Independence (b. 1713)
* March 21 – Francis Lewis, signer of the United States Declaration of Independence (d. 1802)

response: *Francis Lewis (1713–1803), signatory of the American Declaration of Independence
*Francis Lewis (1713–1802); one of the signatories of the United States Declaration of Independence.

link_mentions.page: List of people on the postage stamps of the United States

response: On 31 March 1803, Sumner married Marianne Robertson (1779-1829) in the parochial chapel of St Mary Walcot, Bath, Somerset. She was the daughter of George Robertson of Edinburgh (1742-1791), a captain in the Royal Navy, and Ann (née Lewis) Robertson (1748-1802). His wife's maternal grandparents were Francis Lewis, a New York signatory of the Declaration of Independence, and Elizabeth (née Anessley) Lewis. Sumner and wife had  at least nine children:

response: *Francis Lewis (1713–1803), signatory of the United States Declaration of Independence

#Trinity Churchyard, surrounding the church at Wall Street and Broadway, is where Alexander Hamilton, Elizabeth Schuyler Hamilton, Angelica Schuyler Church, Philip Hamilton, William Bradford, Franklin Wharton, Robert Fulton, Captain James Lawrence, William Alexander, Lord Stirling, Francis Lewis, Albert Gallatin, and Hercules Mulligan are buried.
